item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 3, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (405 points | 292 comments)
2. The DeskThing: the perfect desk assistant (25 points | 15 comments)
3. ToolGit: A collection of scripts that extend Git with various sub-commands (15 points | 6 comments)
4. Programming Languages That Blew My Mind (2023) (23 points | 12 comments)
5. Create block devices on your computer backed by Redstone Memory (122 points | 25 comments)
6. A React Renderer for Gnome JavaScript (73 points | 26 comments)
7. Unix core utilities implemented in Haskell (155 points | 52 comments)
8. pg_flo – Stream, transform, and re-route PostgreSQL data in real-time (8 points | 1 comment)
9. GoGoGrandparent (YC S16) Is Hiring Back End and Full-Stack Engineers ( | hide)
10. Speed, scale and reliability: 25 years of Google datacenter networking evolution (211 points | 44 comments)
11. Big Data for the Leviathan (29 points | 6 comments)
12. Venvstacks: Virtual Environment Stacks for Python (82 points | 31 comments)
13. I couldn't find a free, no-login, no-AI checklist app–so I built one (63 points | 74 comments)
14. Get me out of data hell (529 points | 209 comments)
15. The motor turns too much (347 points | 163 comments)
16. Turn your phone or tablet into a chess clock (14 points | 15 comments)
17. How to Correctly Sum Up Numbers (24 points | 18 comments)
18. Ractor – a Rust Actor Framework (128 points | 61 comments)
19. Eighty Years of the Finite Element Method (2022) (182 points | 92 comments)
20. Weird Lexical Syntax (402 points | 210 comments)
21. Matrix 2.0 Is Here (159 points | 50 comments)
22. Next Generation Out of Band Garbage Collection (153 points | 75 comments)
23. $200M a year, 700k tons of rice, space tech: deal for North Korea in joining war (3 points | 1 comment)
24. Spann: Highly-Efficient Billion-Scale Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search (2021) (112 points | 27 comments)
25. SpawELO – small free matchmaking system for LAN parties (170 points | 44 comments)
26. Ask HN: What would you preserve if the internet were to go down tomorrow? (79 points | 103 comments)
27. Engineers invent high-yield atmospheric water capture device for arid regions (7 points | 2 comments)
28. The inventor of the automatic rice cooker (206 points | 173 comments)
29. If you need the money, don't take the job (221 points | 134 comments)
30. Show HN: A minimalist (brutalist?) website for sharing all your links (270 points | 145 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 3, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
